title: Trump Looks to Avoid Casting Blame in Texas Flood as Democrats Question Cuts

summary: A beloved teacher, child and adult campers, camp directors and a counselor are among at least 104 people who have died in the flooding in Central Texas.

summary: The Trump administration and its predecessors will face scrutiny over the disaster that has killed more than 100 people.

title: Trump Revives Trade War, Threatening Steep Aug. 1 Tariffs on Allies
summary: President Trump said Japan and South Korea would face tariffs of 25 percent unless they reached an agreement with the United States. Other countries received notice of higher levies.

title: As Renewed U.S. Tariffs Loom, Emerging Economies Turn to One Another
summary: With President Trump preparing to revive tariffs this week, some of the world’s biggest exporters are planning a future less dependent on trade with the United States.

title: Here Are Trump’s New Tariff Threats
summary: President Trump has told 14 countries that they will face tariffs of at least 25 percent on Aug. 1 if they don’t reach agreements by then.

title: Trump Administration Acknowledges Lack of Evidence for Jeffrey Epstein ‘Client List’
summary: After Attorney General Pam Bondi promised big revelations for months, the Justice Department noted a lack of evidence for conspiracy theories, including a “client list” and a jailhouse murder.

summary: The plan directly contradicted the White House, which last month described as “fake news” reports of plans to re-deport Kilmar Armando Abrego Garcia.

title: How a Show About Truly Terrible People Became the Defining American Sitcom
summary: Over the last 20 years, television has changed, but the malignant narcissists of “It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia” have not.

summary: Building a viable new political party to rival the Democrats and Republicans is enormously difficult and expensive. Small wonder it hasn’t been done.

summary: Roman V. Starovoyt, the transport minister, had governed the Kursk region before Ukrainian forces occupied part of it in 2024.
